title: "Background" refresh for "What's new" tab

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: Issue or discussion is a duplicate of an existing issue or discussion

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.
- [X] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues).
- [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise.
- [X] This issue contains only one feature request.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Feature description

When refresh is triggered, the list with the videos is emptied at the beginning of the refresh and the status of the refresh is shown in the middle of the screen.
If possible please move the status into the bar that you have tap to trigger the refresh and empty and recreate/replace the list as the last step before presenting the refreshed list.

### Why do you want this feature?

It would make the procedure of watching a video from the old list while it is beeing refreshed a lot easier.
Procedure now:
1. start a video from old list
2. pause
3. minimize
4. refresh
5. maximize
6. resume playback
7. video ends be "greeted" with new list

Procedure (if adjustable):
1. refresh
2. choose video
3. start playback
4. video ends be "greeted" with new list

Thank you for your great work and thanks in advance
IG


### Additional information

_No response_

title: playback footer shows wrong video

labels.name: question

body:
### Affected version

0.25.2

### Steps to reproduce the bug

precondition: I am looking at my "all" videos playlist of the channels I have "subscribed" to via NP


1) start playing video A (click on it)
2) press back button
=> playlist is shown again // ok
=> at the bottom there is a footer showing me  video A I clicked  play on and some of its details // ok
3) open video B and play it in the background by clicking on the background button 
=> B starts playing // ok
4) press back
=> video A page is showing (weird but I see how it makes sense)
5) press back again
=> you return to the playlist again // ok
6) click on the footer that still shows video Bs details
=> you are redirected to paused video A while B continues playing // bug 




### Affected Android/Custom ROM version

android 12 / miui global 14.0.5

### Affected device model

redmi note 10

When I choose another youtube video, that means I don't need the previous video. The current software behavior seems to make the video waiting in the background. That make me have to close them one by one in this video chain.

labels.name: youtube
labels.description: Service, https://www.youtube.com/

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.
- [X] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues).
- [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise.
- [X] This issue contains only one feature request.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Feature description

Youtube has recently started letting (some) movies be shown on youtube, complete & "Free with ads". However, there is a _minor_ problem with _playing_ such videos.

I only have an android tablet (Android 11, not rooted) & I use 3 browsers on it (Chrome, 1dm+, & X-Browser).
If you go to one of these youtube movies on an _android_ phone/tablet in a BROWSER using the MOBILE version of that youtube movie's URL (example = https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=ZhHRh_1ufnI) you'll see this message.
**This content can't be played on your mobile browser. Get the YouTube app to start watching.**
If you paste that URL into NewPipe's search bar & go to it, you'll see this message.
**Sorry, something went wrong.** (with a giant sad emoticon face)
If you go to that URL in a browser & choose "Desktop mode" in your browser & then refresh the page, it will change the URL into this (https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=ZhHRh_1ufnI) & you'll be able to play the video.

The problem (for NewPipe) is that either there is not a way to do that, or if there is, I haven't found it. Therefore, I request that NewPipe should be given a way to play such videos. It seems like a solution could be as simple as adding a "Desktop mode" option to it.

### Why do you want this feature?

I'll add that for most of the youtube movies I can find most of them somewhere else. However, _those_ sites are always getting taken down, whereas youtube is not in danger of that happening. Therefore, watching/downloading those specific movies would be made more doable if NewPipe gets this requested feature.

### Additional information

_No response_

body:
#### What is it?
- [x] Bugfix (user facing)
- [x] Codebase improvement (dev facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR

This PR removes OPUS HLS streams from playable streams. This format is not supported by ExoPlayer when returned as HLS streams, so we can't play streams using this format and this delivery method.

It also improves the Javadoc of `ListHelper.getPlayableStreams`.

#### Fixes the following issue(s)
- Fixes #9227

title: Restore player service start handling before player UI separation and fix some issues in this service

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue is related to a bug

labels.name: player
labels.description: Issues related to any player (main, popup and background)

labels.name: player notification
labels.description: Anything to do with the MediaStyle notification

body:
#### What is it?
- [x] Bugfix (user facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR

This PR restores the player service start handling before player UI separation, shipped with 0.24.0. This handling avoided crashes about the service service not starting in the foreground, in time or not at all (so crashes for which their exception contained `Context.startForegroundService() did not then call Service.startForeground()`). See https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/9358#issuecomment-1722546621 for more details.

This PR also adds some player nullability checks, and the player service is now stopped when it has been started from a media button and there is nothing to play, which should avoid empty player notifications with the previous behavior.

A proper and better player code and architecture is required in order to solve this player service issue in the good way, which must be made in the upcoming app rewrite.

#### Fixes the following issue(s)

- Fixes #9030, fixes #9063, fixes #9070, fixes #9358, fixes #9390, fixes #9448, fixes #10460

Although this PR should fixes these issues, there is a chance, thanks to the current bad player code, that it may not fix them entirely; if so, it should mitigate them a lot.

#### APK testing
The APK can be found by going to the "Checks" tab below the title. On the left pane, click on "CI", scroll down to "artifacts" and click "app" to download the zip file which contains the debug APK of this PR. You can find more info and a video demonstration [on this wiki page](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/wiki/Download-APK-for-PR).

body:
#### What is it?
- [x] Bugfix (user facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR

This PR fixes a crash when building the play queue audio track menu if the player is null.

It makes sure that the player is not null, by using `Optional`s on the player itself instead of its methods returning `Optional`s.

If the player is null, the play queue audio track menu will now be hidden instead of crashing the app.

#### Fixes the following issue(s)
- Fixes #10339, reported again on Reddit recently: https://www.reddit.com/r/NewPipe/comments/17b0vre/please_help_make_this_crash_stop_galaxy_s21/

labels.name: feed
labels.description: Issue is related to the feed

body:
#### What is it?
- [x] Bugfix (user facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR

This PR fixes a crash when setting the masking of the new feed items button if the feed fragment context is null (see the Javadoc of [`Fragment.getContext()`](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/fragment/app/Fragment?hl=en#getContext())).

It makes sure that the context is not null before calling `DeviceUtils.hasAnimationsAnimatorDurationEnabled`.

If the context is null, the button will now not be hidden automatically instead of crashing the app.

#### Fixes the following issue(s)
- Fixes #9031, reported again on Reddit recently: https://www.reddit.com/r/NewPipe/comments/17u8zc9/this_app_keeps_crashing_every_time_i_watch_a/

body:

- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Affected version

0.25.2

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1) Start NewPipe as normal.
2) Paste one of the video URLs into NewPipe & press the "Return" button on my (on screen) keyboard.
(The video URLs are located below.)
3) Newpipe will go to that video's youtube "page".
4) Press the "Play" button to _try_ to play the video.

### Expected behavior

The expected behavior is that NewPipe should be able to play the videos that I have included links to. Also, I cannot say if this problem occured (or not) in previous versions of NewPipe because I only found the videos recently.

### Actual behavior

If you follow the "Steps to reproduce the bug" (see that section above), then if you _try_ to play one of the videos, the video will NOT play. Instead, I get the following error message.
**"An error occurred, see the notification"**
The notification message is this.
**"NewPipe encountered an error, tap to report
Unrecoverable player error occurred"**

This does _not_ cause any other problems using NewPipe (example = doing this does not make NewPipe crash), & NewPipe (0.25.2) IS able to play _most_ youtube videos without any problem, but the following youtube videos experience the bug that I'm reporting.

https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cl9LZiB0oao/maxresdefault.jpg
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/FX4t1lLNl-o/maxresdefault.jpg
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/otNh9bTjXWg/maxresdefault.jpg
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RDE6Uz73A7g/maxresdefault.jpg
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/vOl1uBC3sjs/maxresdefault.jpg

For some reason involving a serious design FAILURE, NewPipe does NOT have a way to give me a youtube video's URL. Instead, I can only get the URL for their THUMBNAILS (from NewPipe). However, I know how to _convert_ those into youtube VIDEO URLs, so here they are.

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=cl9LZiB0oao
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=FX4t1lLNl-o
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=otNh9bTjXWg
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=RDE6Uz73A7g
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=vOl1uBC3sjs

I have tried both using & not using a VPN with those videos, but it doesn't help NewPipe play them. I found a similar topic in the "Issues" section (https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/9255), but it said that it was probably related to their specific WIFI, so I doubt that the same is true for me because I only use _one_ WIFI, & all of these _all_ of these videos DO work in _browsers_ on that WIFI.

### Screenshots/Screen recordings

_No response_

### Logs

_No response_

### Affected Android/Custom ROM version

Android 11 (not rooted, came with the device)

### Affected device model

Samsung Galaxy Tab A7

### Additional information

If more information from me is wanted or needed, ask & I'll provide it. I'll check on this at least once a day, so expect a delay in getting a response from me. Also, adding a way to get a youtube video's URL would be helpful for many reasons (example = bug reports).

### Steps to reproduce the bug

Simple, download something, pause it, close the app or open any other apps until it causes newpipe to refresh itself on open (or if it crashes too). Go to downloads. Find your paused download gone.
______________________________
So if there is a download and the user decides to pause it, why the fuck does the app auto-deletes what's paused from the downloads list if the app is closed, refreshed due to low ram etc OR oh lord it CRASHES because it's mega buggy (to the point that it's funny how some high priority bugs are left unaddressed)? That's just stupid, really stupid.. It would be pretty nice if it DIDN'T do that, causing the user to have to redownload the entire video FROM SCRATCH.

Also uh when will those 1.2k open issue reports get addressed? Seems to me like at this point it's better to just use Youtube and move on from using newpipe if y'all just abandoned it causing anyother fork to be stalled too because ya can't be bothered to just give the reigns to somebody else really.

### Expected behavior

Not getting my shit deleted if i close the app, it is forcefully refreshed due to other apps hogging the ram or god forbid this buggy piece of software doesn't crash from simply doing basic things

### Actual behavior

As explained before, download gets wiped if it's a paused one.
Fix this shit. Who tf thought it was a brilliant idea?

body:
<!-- Hey there. Thank you so much for improving NewPipe, and filling out the details. Having roughly the same layout helps everyone considerably :)-->

#### What is it?
- [X] Bugfix (user facing)
- [ ] Feature (user facing)
- [ ] Codebase improvement (dev facing)
- [ ] Meta improvement to the project (dev facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR
<!-- While bullet points are the norm in this section, feel free to write free-form text instead of a list -->
- Made MediaSessionPlayerUi.sessionConnector public
- Only return ACTION_SKIP_TO_NEXT and ACTION_SKIP_TO_PREVIOUS in getSupportedQueueNavigatorActions for android < 13
- Set custom actions using sessionConnector.setCustomActionProviders for android >= 13

#### Before/After Screenshots/Screen Record
<!-- If your PR changes the app's UI in any way, please include screenshots or a video showing exactly what changed, so that developers and users can pinpoint it easily. Delete this if it doesn't apply to your PR.-->
- Before:
![imagen](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/assets/24706838/4385d2dc-4ae4-486e-857e-2588d21b0847)
- After:
![280436537-736300f3-35a0-45e0-8c18-b7684cf10cde](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/assets/24706838/d74f523e-c327-4c46-943a-fb9ddc972ee5)


#### Fixes the following issue(s)
<!-- Prefix issues with "Fixes" so that GitHub closes them when the PR is merged (note that each "Fixes #" should be in its own item). Also add any other relevant links. -->
- Fixes #9764

#### APK testing
<!-- Use a new, meaningfully named branch. The name is used as a suffix for the app ID to allow installing and testing multiple versions of NewPipe, e.g. "commentfix", if your PR implements a bugfix for comments. (No names like "patch-0" and "feature-1".)  -->
<!-- Remove the following line if you directly link the APK created by the CI pipeline. Directly linking is preferred if you need to let users test.-->
The APK can be found by going to the "Checks" tab below the title. On the left pane, click on "CI", scroll down to "artifacts" and click "app" to download the zip file which contains the debug APK of this PR. You can find more info and a video demonstration [on this wiki page](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/wiki/Download-APK-for-PR).

#### Due diligence
- [X] I read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/HEAD/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).


I don't really do much java, used a one-element array as a hacky way of getting an out parameter. The two other questionable things that come to mind are making sessionConnector public and maybe the ternary operator usage in getSupportedQueueNavigatorActions.
I have not tested this on android <13 since I don't have on on hand at the moment.

### Feature description

Auto clear history older from an user specific controlled period (at the start of app)

### Why do you want this feature?

Not just me but, a lot might need **resume playback** without storing history (which is not possible). So, this'll emulate the same behaviour, except this keeps the last *x* days of history & playback resume statuses & removes the rest.

### Additional information

Does Newpipe store the time of registration of history content ? If so, implementing this is easy. But if not, implementation is not possible.

title: Magnify button
body:
<!-- Hey there. Thank you so much for improving NewPipe, and filling out the details. Having roughly the same layout helps everyone considerably :)-->

#### What is it?
- [ ] Bugfix (user facing)
- [x] Feature (user facing)
- [ ] Codebase improvement (dev facing)
- [ ] Meta improvement to the project (dev facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR

-  I added the full-screen button and exit-full screen button.
-  I try to implement the rotation method. However, it seems the APP's layout is locked and the developers don't want the APP to rotate. Therefore, even though I implemented those rotation methods on the screen, the screen doesn't change the layout.

#### Before/After Screenshots/Screen Record

- Before
There is no magnify button showing up on the screen.
You can see the picture in the [4478](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/4478)

- After

Normal layout
<!-- If your PR changes the app's UI in any way, please include screenshots or a video showing exactly what changed, so that developers and users can pinpoint it easily. Delete this if it doesn't apply to your PR.-->
![image](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/assets/129358708/428065db-ae1e-42b1-aafa-43d38415a889)

![image](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/assets/129358708/ab7a9d82-9e22-4efc-92a9-ddf27e33410f)

The are two full-screen buttons on the video. One is the default, which is settled by developers on the previous version. The second one on the list is settled by me. However, no matter which one both of them can't do the rotation


#### Fixes the following issue(s)
- Fixes 
- #  [10509](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/10509)
- #  [4478](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues/4478) but no completed fix it because I'm not sure if the developer meant to let the APP screen can't rotate or not

#### Relies on the following changes
-  I changed the setting of the string.xml 
-  I added the full-screen and exit full-screen button on fragment_layout_detail.xml
-  I also added new methods and buttons on the PlayQueueActivity class to show the buttons and implement the rotation method
-  I modify some designs on the globalScreenOrientationLocked method and the MainPlayerUI class because they seems make the button disappear and cause the screen to be locked.

#### APK testing

On the left pane, click on "CI", scroll down to "artifacts" and click "app" to download the zip file which contains the debug APK of this PR. You can find more info and a video demonstration [on this wiki page](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/wiki/Download-APK-for-PR).

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I am able to reproduce the bug with the latest version given here: [CLICK THIS LINK](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/releases/latest).
- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.

- [X] This issue contains only one bug.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Affected version

0.25.2

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Open the app
2. It opens for about .1s
3. It immediately closes

There is no crash report or bug report.
I cannot open the application at all.
It immediately crashes/closes.

This is the second time the app state became in this irrecoverable state.

Clearing the cache, clearing the data, nothing works.
I am forced to reinstall the app, losing all user data and cache since the last time I exported my user.

### Expected behavior

Open the app.

**EITHER**

It opens, and I can use the app.

OR

It crashes with a bug report or trace that it reports immediately after crashing.

### Actual behavior

title: Add setting/s to manage YouTube shorts visibility within the app

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: Issue or discussion is a duplicate of an existing issue or discussion

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.
- [X] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues).
- [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise.
- [X] This issue contains only one feature request.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Feature description

Filter shorts visibility in search index, feeds or in the whole NewPipe app in order to give the user more control over the controversial content of YouTube shorts.

One idea on how these could be added is as settings in the "content" section of the app settings or, in the case of filtering search results, as filtering option when performing a search through the search bar, from the dropdown menù in the top right corner.

Ideally would be great to decide where to make the shorts be visible or not: news, subscriptions, feeds, search indexing etc, but having them on/off completely looks like an easiest feature to add.



### Why do you want this feature?

I'm sure i'm not the only one to have found how annoying can be shorts in your home feeds or when you are searching for something: i remember some years ago you could search for something and get full videos plus some shorts, now you get hundreds of shorts, which get sorted more because ironically they have more views, and way less actual content at the top of your feed / search indexing...

I'm strongly against any kind of short/stories/reels content, i think it's such a different content from the normal youtube videos and i hate to find it everywhere, but i understand someone may still want to see such content, therefore we can leave this to the user, while adding an option to remove it for who considers it less important and is favouring other type of content.

### Additional information

I wasn't sure if this was the right place to post a feature request, or if newpipe extractor would be more appropriate, so sorry if this was misplaced.

I was careful to see if there were similar issues open or closed but didn't find anything, sorry again if this is a duplicate.

Would have loved to see if i could somehow contribute at least a bit and create a pr with such features, but this is all in Java and i know ZERO of it, also have no experience in coding android apps, though i would love to learn...

- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.
- [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the bug report will be dismissed otherwise.
- [X] This issue contains only one bug.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Affected version

0.25.2

### Steps to reproduce the bug

1. Get a device that is almost out of space (~100MB of free storage left)
2. Pick a video with a downloading option that takes more space than the free space available
3. Wait for the app to crash, freeze, stutter or phone reset

### Expected behavior

In the download manager activity, there should show the video with the status "error"

### Actual behavior

There is a decent chance that the app crashes or causes the system to stutter/freeze/reset, the video doesn't show in the download manager

### Screenshots/Screen recordings




https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/assets/76801836/c745e125-6685-4ec3-9c85-3eaa4bdc0dae

_No response_

Android 13 (api 33)

Google Pixel 7 Pro

_No response_

- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.

- [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise.
- [X] This issue contains only one feature request.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Feature description

On the what's new tab, when the eye icon is clicked, a list of filters for the feed are available. It would be nice to have the addition of a filter of the form "videos older than a week" or even "videos older than x days" plainly for that empty inbox feel.

### Why do you want this feature?

This would good for seeing at a glance that there are no new videos.

### Additional information

Something of the form:

Show the following streams
[ ] fully watched
[X] partially watched
[ ] upcoming
[ ] videos older than [7] days

title: Fix crash with disabled thumbnails when trying to play a stream

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue is related to a bug

labels.name: size/small
labels.description: PRs with less than 50 changed lines

body:
#### What is it? - [x] Bugfix (user facing) - [ ] Feature (user facing) - [ ] Codebase improvement (dev facing) - [ ] Meta improvement to the project (dev facing) #### Description of the changes in your PR Fix NullPointerException caused by nullable thumbnail URL String being parsed by URI.parse(). body:
### Checklist

- [X] I made sure that there are *no existing issues* - [open](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues) or [closed](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed) - which I could contribute my information to.
- [X] I have read the [FAQ](https://newpipe.net/FAQ/) and my problem isn't listed.
- [X] I'm aware that this is a request for NewPipe itself and that requests for adding a new service need to be made at [NewPipeExtractor](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipeExtractor/issues).
- [X] I have taken the time to fill in all the required details. I understand that the feature request will be dismissed otherwise.
- [X] This issue contains only one feature request.
- [X] I have read and understood the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Feature description

having accounts section in settings bar so that different people can sign in different accounts for their saved services if they are sharing devices.

### Why do you want this feature?

I have this app installed on my android head unit and this would be good if different people are sitting at the back so that they can open guest mode or sign in to different accounts.

### Affected Android/Custom ROM version MIUI by xiaomi.eu 12.5.4.0 Android 10 ### Affected device model Redmi Note 7 Pro ### Additional information Other age restricted videos load and download fine, even the ones with the blurred thumbnails. E.g. reactions and reuploads of "vomit cake". Only this video doesn't work. Tried to change multiple settings, didn't work. Clearing all data didn't help either. NewPipe is able to display the comments while it tries to load the video, but that's it. You can scroll the comments indefinitely until the error screen removes them. Subsequent attempts don't show the comments until the app is restarted. SkyTube can't play/download the video either, but it doesn't throw any error, it's just stuck and doesn't do anything. Youtube Revanced 18.23.35 plays the video fine.

title: Fix PR labeler permissions

labels.name: meta
labels.description: Related to the project but not strictly to code

labels.name: size/small
labels.description: PRs with less than 50 changed lines

body:
#### What is it?
- [ ] Bugfix (user facing)
- [ ] Feature (user facing)
- [ ] Codebase improvement (dev facing)
- [x] Meta improvement to the project (dev facing)

#### Description of the changes in your PR
Although the permission to modify PRs is granted to the entire workflow, the job still reports that it does not the permission to do so:
```
GITHUB_TOKEN Permissions
  Contents: read
  Metadata: read
  PullRequests: read
```
This adds the permission to the job directly.

#### APK testing
<!-- Use a new, meaningfully named branch. The name is used as a suffix for the app ID to allow installing and testing multiple versions of NewPipe, e.g. "commentfix", if your PR implements a bugfix for comments. (No names like "patch-0" and "feature-1".)  -->
<!-- Remove the following line if you directly link the APK created by the CI pipeline. Directly linking is preferred if you need to let users test.-->
The APK can be found by going to the "Checks" tab below the title. On the left pane, click on "CI", scroll down to "artifacts" and click "app" to download the zip file which contains the debug APK of this PR. You can find more info and a video demonstration [on this wiki page](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/wiki/Download-APK-for-PR).

#### Due diligence
- [x] I read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/TeamNewPipe/NewPipe/blob/HEAD/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).
